Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-orange pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and purple and black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of at least two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394907) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394907)
